bbc news - afghanistan : key facts and figures british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links mobile version skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help bbc news updated every minute of every day one-minute world news news front page africa americas asia-pacific europe middle east south asia uk england northern ireland scotland wales uk politics education magazine business health science & environment technology entertainment also in the news - video and audio - programmes have your say in pictures country profiles special reports related bbc sites sport weather on this day editors ' blog bbc world service page last updated at 09:15 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:15 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version afghanistan : key facts and figures uk forces have been in afghanistan for almost a decade .
the death toll now exceeds that of the iraq war and more than 100 soldiers died last year .
read key facts and figures about the war , and the british and other international forces fighting the taliban and engaged in reconstruction work .
highest monthly death toll comes in july 2009 , with 22 dead , as a major offensive against the taliban begins in the south .
manpower british and other isaf troops face a determined enemy in the taliban .
the insurgents consist mainly of afghans , though numbers of arab and uzbek fighters are also be involved .
groups of fighters are usually organised along local and tribal lines and led by a senior , experienced commander .
here we compare a british soldier with his taliban counterpart .
british soldier main weapons : standard issue sa-80 rifle , l1a1 12.7 mm heavy machine gun , 81mm mortar strengths : highly-trained , well-supported professional soldier with modern equipment .
air support available weaknesses : may struggle to adapt to fighting in the harsh afghan environment .
lacks intimate knowledge of local landscape , may face hostility and distrust from civilians taliban fighter main weapons : kalashnikov ak-47 assault rifle , rocket-propelled grenades .
strengths : tenacious , well-supplied guerrilla force highly adapted to local climate and geography .
can blend in with local population when required .
weaknesses : vulnerable to air attack .
few heavy weapons .
factional nature can mean shifting loyalties .
poor weapons-handling skills .
mobility mobility is a major factor in guerrilla warfare and taliban fighters often operate as a ' pick-up truck cavalry ' force in adapted four-wheel drive vehicles such as the toyota hi-lux .
isaf forces tend to rely on heavier armoured vehicles .
mastiff ii defences : heavy armour and v-shaped hull to protect against roadside bombs and mines .
strengths : state-of-the-art , heavily armed , armoured patrol vehicle designed to carry 8 soldiers and 2 crew .
weaknesses : expensive , requires dedicated maintenance .
cost : approximately £ 1.2 million per vehicle toyota hi lux defences : some carry rpg launchers , heavy machine guns .
strengths : hard-wearing , fast , reliable off-road transport for up to 10 taliban fighters .
weaknesses : no armour , variable levels of mechanical support .
cost : approximately $ 10,000 in local terms .
casualties the true number of civilians killed in the afghan conflict will probably never be known .
isaf has only recently begun to count the numbers of civilians killed .
the estimates below are based on estimates provided by a range of agencies together with local and international press reports .
numbers of troops major combat units reconstruction teams albania 250 fyrom * 215 norway 470 australia 1,550 georgia 175 poland 2,515 austria 3 germany 4,365 portugal 105 azerbaijan 90 greece 70 romania 1010 belgium 590 hungary 360 singapore 40 bosnia and herzegovina 10 iceland 4 slovakia 230 bulgaria 525 ireland 7 slovenia 75 canada 2,830 italy 3,300 spain 1,270 croatia 290 jordan 6 sweden 485 czech rep 460 latvia 115 turkey 1,795 denmark 750 lithuania 145 ukraine 10 estonia 155 luxembourg 8 uae 10 finland 100 netherlands 1,885 uk 9,500 france 3,750 nz 225 us + 32,415 total -lrb- approx . -rrb- : 73,554 * former yugoslav republic of macedonia + the us has around 36,000 additional troops in afghanistan as part of operation enduring freedom bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

<p>
bbc news - afghanistan : key facts and figures british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links mobile version skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help bbc news updated every minute of every day one-minute world news news front page africa americas asia-pacific europe middle east south asia uk england northern ireland scotland wales uk politics education magazine business health science & environment technology entertainment also in the news - video and audio - programmes have your say in pictures country profiles special reports related bbc sites sport weather on this day editors ' blog bbc world service page last updated at 09:15 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:15 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version afghanistan : key facts and figures uk forces have been in afghanistan for almost a decade .
the death toll now exceeds that of the iraq war and more than 100 soldiers died last year .
read key facts and figures about the war , and the british and other international forces fighting the taliban and engaged in reconstruction work .
highest monthly death toll comes in july 2009 , with 22 dead , as a major offensive against the taliban begins in the south .
manpower british and other isaf troops face a determined enemy in the taliban .
the insurgents consist mainly of afghans , though numbers of arab and uzbek fighters are also be involved .
groups of fighters are usually organised along local and tribal lines and led by a senior , experienced commander .
here we compare a british soldier with his taliban counterpart .
british soldier main weapons : standard issue sa-80 rifle , l1a1 12.7 mm heavy machine gun , 81mm mortar strengths : highly-trained , well-supported professional soldier with modern equipment .
air support available weaknesses : may struggle to adapt to fighting in the harsh afghan environment .
lacks intimate knowledge of local landscape , may face hostility and distrust from civilians taliban fighter main weapons : kalashnikov ak-47 assault rifle , rocket-propelled grenades .
strengths : tenacious , well-supplied guerrilla force highly adapted to local climate and geography .
can blend in with local population when required .
weaknesses : vulnerable to air attack .
few heavy weapons .
factional nature can mean shifting loyalties .
poor weapons-handling skills .
mobility mobility is a major factor in guerrilla warfare and taliban fighters often operate as a ' pick-up truck cavalry ' force in adapted four-wheel drive vehicles such as the toyota hi-lux .
isaf forces tend to rely on heavier armoured vehicles .
mastiff ii defences : heavy armour and v-shaped hull to protect against roadside bombs and mines .
strengths : state-of-the-art , heavily armed , armoured patrol vehicle designed to carry 8 soldiers and 2 crew .
weaknesses : expensive , requires dedicated maintenance .
cost : approximately £ 1.2 million per vehicle toyota hi lux defences : some carry rpg launchers , heavy machine guns .
strengths : hard-wearing , fast , reliable off-road transport for up to 10 taliban fighters .
weaknesses : no armour , variable levels of mechanical support .
cost : approximately $ 10,000 in local terms .
casualties the true number of civilians killed in the afghan conflict will probably never be known .
isaf has only recently begun to count the numbers of civilians killed .
the estimates below are based on estimates provided by a range of agencies together with local and international press reports .
numbers of troops major combat units reconstruction teams albania 250 fyrom * 215 norway 470 australia 1,550 georgia 175 poland 2,515 austria 3 germany 4,365 portugal 105 azerbaijan 90 greece 70 romania 1010 belgium 590 hungary 360 singapore 40 bosnia and herzegovina 10 iceland 4 slovakia 230 bulgaria 525 ireland 7 slovenia 75 canada 2,830 italy 3,300 spain 1,270 croatia 290 jordan 6 sweden 485 czech rep 460 latvia 115 turkey 1,795 denmark 750 lithuania 145 ukraine 10 estonia 155 luxembourg 8 uae 10 finland 100 netherlands 1,885 uk 9,500 france 3,750 nz 225 us + 32,415 total -lrb- approx . -rrb- : 73,554 * former yugoslav republic of macedonia + the us has around 36,000 additional troops in afghanistan as part of operation enduring freedom bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

this page is best viewed in an up-to-date web browser with style sheets -lrb- css -rrb- enabled .
while you will be able to view the content of this page in your current browser , you will not be able to get the full visual experience .
please consider upgrading your browser software or enabling style sheets -lrb- css -rrb- if you are able to do so .
<p>
bbc news - afghanistan : key facts and figures british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help bbc news updated every minute of every day one-minute world news news front page africa americas asia-pacific europe middle east south asia uk england northern ireland scotland wales uk politics education magazine business health science & environment technology entertainment also in the news - video and audio - programmes have your say in pictures country profiles special reports related bbc sites sport weather on this day editors ' blog bbc world service page last updated at 09:15 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:15 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version afghanistan : key facts and figures uk forces have been in afghanistan for almost a decade .
the death toll now exceeds that of the iraq war and more than 100 soldiers died last year .
read key facts and figures about the war , and the british and other international forces fighting the taliban and engaged in reconstruction work .
highest monthly death toll comes in july 2009 , with 22 dead , as a major offensive against the taliban begins in the south .
manpower british and other isaf troops face a determined enemy in the taliban .
the insurgents consist mainly of afghans , though numbers of arab and uzbek fighters are also be involved .
groups of fighters are usually organised along local and tribal lines and led by a senior , experienced commander .
here we compare a british soldier with his taliban counterpart .
british soldier main weapons : standard issue sa-80 rifle , l1a1 12.7 mm heavy machine gun , 81mm mortar strengths : highly-trained , well-supported professional soldier with modern equipment .
air support available weaknesses : may struggle to adapt to fighting in the harsh afghan environment .
lacks intimate knowledge of local landscape , may face hostility and distrust from civilians taliban fighter main weapons : kalashnikov ak-47 assault rifle , rocket-propelled grenades .
strengths : tenacious , well-supplied guerrilla force highly adapted to local climate and geography .
can blend in with local population when required .
weaknesses : vulnerable to air attack .
few heavy weapons .
factional nature can mean shifting loyalties .
poor weapons-handling skills .
mobility mobility is a major factor in guerrilla warfare and taliban fighters often operate as a ' pick-up truck cavalry ' force in adapted four-wheel drive vehicles such as the toyota hi-lux .
isaf forces tend to rely on heavier armoured vehicles .
mastiff ii defences : heavy armour and v-shaped hull to protect against roadside bombs and mines .
strengths : state-of-the-art , heavily armed , armoured patrol vehicle designed to carry 8 soldiers and 2 crew .
weaknesses : expensive , requires dedicated maintenance .
cost : approximately £ 1.2 million per vehicle toyota hi lux defences : some carry rpg launchers , heavy machine guns .
strengths : hard-wearing , fast , reliable off-road transport for up to 10 taliban fighters .
weaknesses : no armour , variable levels of mechanical support .
cost : approximately $ 10,000 in local terms .
casualties the true number of civilians killed in the afghan conflict will probably never be known .
isaf has only recently begun to count the numbers of civilians killed .
the estimates below are based on estimates provided by a range of agencies together with local and international press reports .
numbers of troops major combat units reconstruction teams albania 250 fyrom * 215 norway 470 australia 1,550 georgia 175 poland 2,515 austria 3 germany 4,365 portugal 105 azerbaijan 90 greece 70 romania 1010 belgium 590 hungary 360 singapore 40 bosnia and herzegovina 10 iceland 4 slovakia 230 bulgaria 525 ireland 7 slovenia 75 canada 2,830 italy 3,300 spain 1,270 croatia 290 jordan 6 sweden 485 czech rep 460 latvia 115 turkey 1,795 denmark 750 lithuania 145 ukraine 10 estonia 155 luxembourg 8 uae 10 finland 100 netherlands 1,885 uk 9,500 france 3,750 nz 225 us + 32,415 total -lrb- approx . -rrb- : 73,554 * former yugoslav republic of macedonia + the us has around 36,000 additional troops in afghanistan as part of operation enduring freedom bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

isaf forces tend to rely on heavier armoured vehicles .
mastiff ii defences : heavy armour and v-shaped hull to protect against roadside bombs and mines .
strengths : state-of-the-art , heavily armed , armoured patrol vehicle designed to carry 8 soldiers and 2 crew .
weaknesses : expensive , requires dedicated maintenance .
cost : approximately £ 1.2 million per vehicle toyota hi lux defences : some carry rpg launchers , heavy machine guns .
strengths : hard-wearing , fast , reliable off-road transport for up to 10 taliban fighters .
weaknesses : no armour , variable levels of mechanical support .
cost : approximately $ 10,000 in local terms .
casualties the true number of civilians killed in the afghan conflict will probably never be known .
isaf has only recently begun to count the numbers of civilians killed .
the estimates below are based on estimates provided by a range of agencies together with local and international press reports .
numbers of troops major combat units reconstruction teams albania 250 fyrom * 215 norway 470 australia 1,550 georgia 175 poland 2,515 austria 3 germany 4,365 portugal 105 azerbaijan 90 greece 70 romania 1010 belgium 590 hungary 360 singapore 40 bosnia and herzegovina 10 iceland 4 slovakia 230 bulgaria 525 ireland 7 slovenia 75 canada 2,830 italy 3,300 spain 1,270 croatia 290 jordan 6 sweden 485 czech rep 460 latvia 115 turkey 1,795 denmark 750 lithuania 145 ukraine 10 estonia 155 luxembourg 8 uae 10 finland 100 netherlands 1,885 uk 9,500 france 3,750 nz 225 us + 32,415 total -lrb- approx . -rrb- : 73,554 * former yugoslav republic of macedonia + the us has around 36,000 additional troops in afghanistan as part of operation enduring freedom bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

bbc news - afghanistan : key facts and figures british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links mobile version skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help bbc news updated every minute of every day one-minute world news news front page africa americas asia-pacific europe middle east south asia uk england northern ireland scotland wales uk politics education magazine business health science & environment technology entertainment also in the news - video and audio - programmes have your say in pictures country profiles special reports related bbc sites sport weather on this day editors ' blog bbc world service page last updated at 09:15 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:15 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version afghanistan : key facts and figures uk forces have been in afghanistan for almost a decade .
the death toll now exceeds that of the iraq war and more than 100 soldiers died last year .
read key facts and figures about the war , and the british and other international forces fighting the taliban and engaged in reconstruction work .
highest monthly death toll comes in july 2009 , with 22 dead , as a major offensive against the taliban begins in the south .
manpower british and other isaf troops face a determined enemy in the taliban .
the insurgents consist mainly of afghans , though numbers of arab and uzbek fighters are also be involved .
groups of fighters are usually organised along local and tribal lines and led by a senior , experienced commander .
here we compare a british soldier with his taliban counterpart .
british soldier main weapons : standard issue sa-80 rifle , l1a1 12.7 mm heavy machine gun , 81mm mortar strengths : highly-trained , well-supported professional soldier with modern equipment .
air support available weaknesses : may struggle to adapt to fighting in the harsh afghan environment .
lacks intimate knowledge of local landscape , may face hostility and distrust from civilians taliban fighter main weapons : kalashnikov ak-47 assault rifle , rocket-propelled grenades .
strengths : tenacious , well-supplied guerrilla force highly adapted to local climate and geography .
can blend in with local population when required .
weaknesses : vulnerable to air attack .
few heavy weapons .
factional nature can mean shifting loyalties .
poor weapons-handling skills .
mobility mobility is a major factor in guerrilla warfare and taliban fighters often operate as a ' pick-up truck cavalry ' force in adapted four-wheel drive vehicles such as the toyota hi-lux .
isaf forces tend to rely on heavier armoured vehicles .
mastiff ii defences : heavy armour and v-shaped hull to protect against roadside bombs and mines .
strengths : state-of-the-art , heavily armed , armoured patrol vehicle designed to carry 8 soldiers and 2 crew .
weaknesses : expensive , requires dedicated maintenance .
cost : approximately £ 1.2 million per vehicle toyota hi lux defences : some carry rpg launchers , heavy machine guns .
strengths : hard-wearing , fast , reliable off-road transport for up to 10 taliban fighters .
weaknesses : no armour , variable levels of mechanical support .
cost : approximately $ 10,000 in local terms .
casualties the true number of civilians killed in the afghan conflict will probably never be known .
isaf has only recently begun to count the numbers of civilians killed .
the estimates below are based on estimates provided by a range of agencies together with local and international press reports .
numbers of troops major combat units reconstruction teams albania 250 fyrom * 215 norway 470 australia 1,550 georgia 175 poland 2,515 austria 3 germany 4,365 portugal 105 azerbaijan 90 greece 70 romania 1010 belgium 590 hungary 360 singapore 40 bosnia and herzegovina 10 iceland 4 slovakia 230 bulgaria 525 ireland 7 slovenia 75 canada 2,830 italy 3,300 spain 1,270 croatia 290 jordan 6 sweden 485 czech rep 460 latvia 115 turkey 1,795 denmark 750 lithuania 145 ukraine 10 estonia 155 luxembourg 8 uae 10 finland 100 netherlands 1,885 uk 9,500 france 3,750 nz 225 us + 32,415 total -lrb- approx . -rrb- : 73,554 * former yugoslav republic of macedonia + the us has around 36,000 additional troops in afghanistan as part of operation enduring freedom bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

bbc - north east scotland orkney & shetland - the top things to do in july / things to do bbc local -pipe- ne scot & n. isles -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- 09:20 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:20 uk the top things to do in july a few suggestions to help you plan the next few weeks ...
dufftown heritage festival 3 - 4 july dufftown dufftown celebrates its heritage in events commemorating the 1000th anniversary of the battle of mortlach when danish vikings were defeated by scottish forces .
the weekend events include a parade , a battle re-enactment , a heritage walk and tours of mortlach distillery and balvenie castle .
dufftown heritage festival shetland nature festival 3 - 11 july various locations across shetland celebrate the wonder of nature in this series of walks , talks and workshops taking place across shetland .
choose from a creepy-crawlies family workshop , a date with nature at sumburgh head or a " shetland rocks ! " family fun day .
for a full list of activities see : shetland nature festival stonehaven folk festival 8 - 11 july various venues in stonehaven a feast of folk music is happening in stonehaven .
performers include shooglenifty and show of hands .
an aqua ceilidh , song-writing workshops and the world paper ' n ' comb championship are some of the activities on offer .
stonehaven folk festival hopeman gala week 16 - 24 july hopeman enjoy the festivities in hopeman .
events and activities are happening throughout the week and include a fancy-dress parade , the crowning of the gala queen , a duck hunt and a harbour night .
hopeman gala week new deer show 17 - 18 july craigieford park , new deer the events at the show range from a grand parade of horses and cattle to a tug o ' war match and " chariots of fire " .
for a full list of events see : new deer show peterhead scottish week 17 - 24 july peterhead peterhead and the surrounding area celebrate their maritime heritage with a week of activities .
see the crowning of the buchan queen , try a sailing taster session , take part in a sandcastle building competition , hear some sea songs and salty tales , enjoy the family fun day or watch the fireworks on finale night .
peterhead scottish week stromness shopping week 18 - 24 july stromness take part in the longest running festival in orkney .
events include a parade , concerts , street performers , a beer race and a yard of ale competition .
stromness shopping week jacobite day 25 july braemar castle take a tour of braemar castle in the company of a " jacobite " guide .
enjoy an open-air drama recounting bonnie prince charlie 's escapades in scotland .
braemar castle speyfest 29 july - 1 august fochabers get your toes tapping at this festival of traditional and contemporary celtic music .
the red hot chilli pipers , capercaillie and hayseed dixie are amongst the acts appearing at speyfest .
open sessions , workshops and a " survivor 's ceilidh " add to the musical mix .
speyfest highland games various dates in july take your pick of the piping , dancing and heavy events happening across the region : forres highland games and braemar junior highland games kick off the month on 10 july followed by tomintoul highland games on 17 july .
stonehaven highland games take place on 18 july and the month ends with dufftown highland games on 31 july .
forres highland games braemar junior highland games highland games 2010 e-mail this to a friend s1 play the list what 's on scotland braemar castle braemar junior highland games dufftown heritage festival forres highland games highland games 2010 hopeman gala week new deer show peterhead scottish week shetland nature festival speyfest stonehaven folk festival stromness shopping week bbc local -pipe- ne scot & n. isles -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe-
<p>
bbc - mid wales - people & places bbc - mid wales / people & places bbc local -pipe- mid wales -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:20 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:20 uk llangammarch community saves hall a £ 250,000 grant has enabled villagers in llangammarch wells to save its chapel hall .
helping the plight of humble bees mike and june huntley from cross inn explain why they started keeping honey bees .
more people & places bumper grant rejuvenates village a £ 400,000 project to renovate a village community centre includes the opening of a new village shop .
call for more off-road volunteers a volunteer group that helps the emergency planning services is on the hunt for more volunteers .
parachute regiment legend : part 3 the final instalment of grafton maggs ' memories of major humphrey lloyd-jones of the parachute regiment .
osprey 's flight is right on track a satellite tracking system uncovers that ospreys use the elan valley as a feeding stop on their migration from africa .
golden jubilee at gregynog hall the university of wales celebrates its 50th anniversary at the helm of gregynog hall .
montgomeryshire 's hidden heritage the living stones trail opens in may and comprises three trails in montgomeryshire .

dufftown heritage festival 3 - 4 july dufftown dufftown celebrates its heritage in events commemorating the 1000th anniversary of the battle of mortlach when danish vikings were defeated by scottish forces .
the weekend events include a parade , a battle re-enactment , a heritage walk and tours of mortlach distillery and balvenie castle .
dufftown heritage festival shetland nature festival enjoy a walk at sumburgh head as part of the shetland nature festival 3 - 11 july various locations across shetland celebrate the wonder of nature in this series of walks , talks and workshops taking place across shetland .
choose from a creepy-crawlies family workshop , a date with nature at sumburgh head or a " shetland rocks ! " family fun day .
for a full list of activities see : shetland nature festival stonehaven folk festival 8 - 11 july various venues in stonehaven a feast of folk music is happening in stonehaven .
performers include shooglenifty and show of hands .
an aqua ceilidh , song-writing workshops and the world paper ' n ' comb championship are some of the activities on offer .
stonehaven folk festival hopeman gala week 16 - 24 july hopeman enjoy the festivities in hopeman .
events and activities are happening throughout the week and include a fancy-dress parade , the crowning of the gala queen , a duck hunt and a harbour night .
hopeman gala week new deer show 17 - 18 july craigieford park , new deer the events at the show range from a grand parade of horses and cattle to a tug o ' war match and " chariots of fire " .
for a full list of events see : new deer show peterhead scottish week 17 - 24 july peterhead peterhead and the surrounding area celebrate their maritime heritage with a week of activities .
see the crowning of the buchan queen , try a sailing taster session , take part in a sandcastle building competition , hear some sea songs and salty tales , enjoy the family fun day or watch the fireworks on finale night .
peterhead scottish week stromness shopping week 18 - 24 july stromness take part in the longest running festival in orkney .
events include a parade , concerts , street performers , a beer race and a yard of ale competition .
stromness shopping week jacobite day 25 july braemar castle take a tour of braemar castle in the company of a " jacobite " guide .
enjoy an open-air drama recounting bonnie prince charlie 's escapades in scotland .
braemar castle speyfest the red hot chilli pipers will be appearing at speyfest 29 july - 1 august fochabers get your toes tapping at this festival of traditional and contemporary celtic music .
the red hot chilli pipers , capercaillie and hayseed dixie are amongst the acts appearing at speyfest .
open sessions , workshops and a " survivor 's ceilidh " add to the musical mix .
speyfest highland games various dates in july take your pick of the piping , dancing and heavy events happening across the region : forres highland games and braemar junior highland games kick off the month on 10 july followed by tomintoul highland games on 17 july .
stonehaven highland games take place on 18 july and the month ends with dufftown highland games on 31 july .
forres highland games braemar junior highland games highland games 2010 bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

bbc - in pictures : weather around the island in june british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help guernsey bbc guernsey listen live to bbc guernsey on iplayer listen again to bbc guernsey on iplayer bbc local guernsey things to do people & places nature & outdoors history religion & ethics arts & culture bbc introducing the states tv & radio local bbc sites news sport weather travel neighbouring sites devon dorset hampshire jersey related bbc sites england page last updated at 09:23 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:23 uk e-mail this to a friend in pictures : weather around the island in june stephen buck from oxford sent in this photo of a sunny day on guernsey 's south coast from his trip to the island in june .
for the chance to get your weather photos in this gallery send them to guernsey @ bbc.co.uk guernsey airport suffered disruption on wednesday 30 june as fog descended on the island causing flight delays and cancellations .
friday the 18 june saw a sunny and hot start to the day as the sun beat down on the calm blue sea at vazon bay .
the cruise ship island sky was moored in local waters as the sun shone down on the islands on friday 18 june 2010 .
the blue sky broke through the clouds over st peter port to welcome the cruise liner crystal symphony and its 975 passengers on tuesday 15 june .
the morning of 10 june started with thick fog clinging to guernsey , especially over the hills to the south , disrupting air travel to and from the island .
the marco polo brought 850 passengers to guernsey on 8 june and although the day started cloudy sun was promised later .
after a hot and sunny weekend clouds began to encroach over guernsey on the morning of monday 7 june and brought rain later in the day .
despite the cloud the sea off the east coast and in st peter port harbour remained flat calm on the morning of 7 june .
the hot weather continued as the first week of june came to an end and temperatures reached 24c over pembroke bay .
the sun shone down on le guet from a clear blue sky in the morning of wednesday 2 june with the prediction that the good weather would continue into the weekend .
following a damp and foggy first of june the second was an all together affair with clear skies and warm air from the start of the day .
june started out wet and foggy over the bailiwick following a mixed bank holiday weekend .
planes were grounded as the fog clung to the island for most of the day .
see also in pictures : weather in may 28 may 10 -pipe- nature & outdoors e-mail this to a friend bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

bbc - north west wales - work starts to save iconic church / religion & ethics bbc local -pipe- north west wales -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- 09:26 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:26 uk work starts to save iconic church work is beginning to restore one of anglesey 's most unusual churches , designed by a former italian prisoner of war to look like a ship .
our lady star of the sea and st winefride 's is the catholic church for amlwch , but has been closed since 2004 when increasing damp endangered the electrics .
now restoration project leader chris thomas has finally secured the funds to begin making this iconic building safe .
" trying to keep the water out has been a constant problem since this church was built in the 1930s , " admitted chris , who 's volunteered to help out with the project .
" we 've had an expert look at it and they 're going to use a specialist , flexible material which will move with the building and keep the damp out once and for all . "
chris has received much good will from the community who want to see this nautical-themed church saved for future use .
" it 's right on the anglesey coastal path and coaches come by especially to look at it , " he explained .
" it 's not a building you expect to come across there , so it 's become quite a landmark . "
our lady star of the sea was designed by italian engineer , giuseppe rinvolucri , who married a local girl after coming to britain as a prisoner of war during world war i. he designed a number of north wales catholic churches , including porthmadog and abergele .
but while they are in the more traditional , byzantine cross-style , he decided on something very different for amlwch .
" it 's shaped like an up-turned hull with portholes , " said chris .
giuseppe 's son told him his father would visit the site where he was going to build a church to soak up the atmosphere .
" he would then paint a picture and use that as the basis of his architectural work , " said chris .
" sadly , we do n't know any more about his thinking behind this unique church , although the family do still have that original drawing .
" but the beauty of his idea is that he created a church which respects where it is , set between the land and the sea . "
chris is particularly looking forward to seeing the effect of the light through the three glazed panels of the elliptical arch when the building is restored .
" they throw extraordinary light .
it 's almost like a lighthouse for sailors out on the sea , with three beams of light shooting up into the sky .
" and they bring exquisite natural light into the church , even on a dull day . "
as a practising catholic , chris sees the importance of re-opening the church as a house of prayer for local worshippers who 've had to travel to cemaes and benllech for mass .
he also hopes to secure further funds to build a hoist between the three levels of the church so older parishioners do n't have to negotiate the outside steps .
" it was hard to raise all the money during a recession , and amlwch is n't the most fashionable part of wales , right on the edge of the irish sea away from everything , " said chris .
" but there is still great enthusiasm , and once we have the place watertight it 's onwards and upwards . "
robert jones of beaumaris : i think it is worthy of mention how the whole mass of imitation stone frontage was done by one plasterer long gone called llew -lrb- inja rock -rrb- , whose pretty unique style of work is still to be seen elsewhere around town today .
he once showed me how it was done , all with a little teaspoon .
what patience and what a proven good job to stand the trial of time of 40-plus years without a great deal , if any , remedial work .
a sound memorial to a good working man .
e-mail this to a friend wrexham diocese oblate of mary immaculate , anglesey bbc local -pipe- north west wales -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- people & places contents : nature & outdoors -pipe- history -pipe- religion & ethics -pipe- arts & culture -pipe- bbc introducing

bbc - work starts to restore amlwch 's iconic catholic church british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help north west wales bbc radio wales listen live to bbc radio wales on iplayer listen again to bbc radio wales on iplayer bbc local north west wales things to do people & places nature & outdoors history religion & ethics arts & culture music tv & radio local bbc sites news sport weather travel neighbouring sites mid wales north east wales related bbc sites wales cymru gogledd orllewin page last updated at 09:26 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:26 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version work starts to restore amlwch 's iconic catholic church restoration work is scheduled to be completed by november 2010 work is beginning to restore one of anglesey 's most unusual churches , designed by a former italian prisoner of war to look like a ship .
our lady star of the sea and st winefride 's is the catholic church for amlwch , but has been closed since 2004 when increasing damp endangered the electrics .
now restoration project leader chris thomas has finally secured the funds to begin making this iconic building safe .
" trying to keep the water out has been a constant problem since this church was built in the 1930s , " admitted chris , who 's volunteered to help out with the project .
" we 've had an expert look at it and they 're going to use a specialist , flexible material which will move with the building and keep the damp out once and for all . "
chris has received much good will from the community who want to see this nautical-themed church saved for future use .
" it 's right on the anglesey coastal path and coaches come by especially to look at it , " he explained .
" it 's not a building you expect to come across there , so it 's become quite a landmark . "
anglesey 's catholic churches are run by the oblate missionary our lady star of the sea was designed by italian engineer , giuseppe rinvolucri , who married a local girl after coming to britain as a prisoner of war during world war i. he designed a number of north wales catholic churches , including porthmadog and abergele .
but while they are in the more traditional , byzantine cross-style , he decided on something very different for amlwch .
" it 's shaped like an up-turned hull with portholes , " said chris .
giuseppe 's son told him his father would visit the site where he was going to build a church to soak up the atmosphere .
" he would then paint a picture and use that as the basis of his architectural work , " said chris .
" sadly , we do n't know any more about his thinking behind this unique church , although the family do still have that original drawing .
" but the beauty of his idea is that he created a church which respects where it is , set between the land and the sea . "
chris is particularly looking forward to seeing the effect of the light through the three glazed panels of the elliptical arch when the building is restored .
all oblate churches are dedicated to mary immaculate .
" they throw extraordinary light .
it 's almost like a lighthouse for sailors out on the sea , with three beams of light shooting up into the sky .
" and they bring exquisite natural light into the church , even on a dull day . "
as a practising catholic , chris sees the importance of re-opening the church as a house of prayer for local worshippers who 've had to travel to cemaes and benllech for mass .
he also hopes to secure further funds to build a hoist between the three levels of the church so older parishioners do n't have to negotiate the outside steps .
" it was hard to raise all the money during a recession , and amlwch is n't the most fashionable part of wales , right on the edge of the irish sea away from everything , " said chris .
" but there is still great enthusiasm , and once we have the place watertight it 's onwards and upwards . "
robert jones of beaumaris : i think it is worthy of mention how the whole mass of imitation stone frontage was done by one plasterer long gone called llew -lrb- inja rock -rrb- , whose pretty unique style of work is still to be seen elsewhere around town today .
he once showed me how it was done , all with a little teaspoon .
what patience and what a proven good job to stand the trial of time of 40-plus years without a great deal , if any , remedial work .
a sound memorial to a good working man .

bbc - north east scotland orkney & shetland - things to do bbc - north east scotland orkney & shetland / things to do bbc local -pipe- ne scot & n. isles -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:29 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:29 uk the top things to do in july get ideas for days out in north east scotland , orkney and shetland .
get ready for the big lunch we 're inviting you to have lunch with your neighbours – in streets , parks , gardens , car parks on sunday , 18 july .
explore family-friendly days out find out more about what makes a great day out in north east scotland , orkney and shetland .
send in your suggestions .
more things to do explore the webcams of the area discover a different view of the area by taking a peek at places through a webcam from aberdeenshire to shetland .
silver surfers ' day 2010 events on friday , 21 may , are devoted to helping the over 50s get online and make the most of digital technology .
cycling routes around the country get on your bike and spring into action by taking to the hills or the cycle tracks around scotland .
tell us your total trivia facts we are looking for your trivia tales about north east scotland , orkney and shetland .
learn new skills with the bbc pick up new skills , take part in local activities and improve your local area with help from the bbc outreach .
follow the path of robert burns details of the bard 's ' highland ' tour , the places he visited and the people he met along the way .
gaelic language resources for you learn more about gaelic with the help of bbc alba and find out what 's available for you if you 're already proficient in the language .

bbc - live dorset webcams british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help dorset bbc radio solent listen live to bbc radio solent on iplayer listen again to bbc radio solent on iplayer bbc local dorset things to do people & places nature & outdoors history religion & ethics arts & culture bbc introducing tv & radio local bbc sites news sport weather travel neighbouring sites devon guernsey hampshire somerset related bbc sites england page last updated at 09:31 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:31 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version live dorset webcams bournemouth beach webcam looking out to sea at bournemouth beach , as seen from a webcam at the top of a hotel in the town 's priory road .
bournemouth beach webcam weymouth beach webcam a wide shot of weymouth beach and esplanade , looking westwards to the pavilion .
weymouth beach webcam seatown beach webcam seatown beach webcam from golden cap holiday park , west dorset .
the beach is part of the world heritage coastline .
seatown beach webcam avon beach webcam avon beach , christchurch , looking towards barton .
webcam image is only operational during office hours .
avon beach webcam west bay webcam this webcam shows the view across west bay harbour and lyme bay to portland bill .
the fishing harbour and seaside resort of west bay is situated at the western end of chesil beach on the jurassic coast .
west bay webcam swanage webcam this webcam shows the view over swanage bay towards ballard down and old harry rocks .
swanage webcam weymouth weathercam this camera looks out from overcombe over portland bay - it 's part of a website set up to monitor weather conditions along this part of the dorset coast .
weymouth weathercam christchurch , new zealand the camera is located 60m up on richmond hill , about 12 km from the centre of christchurch .
it points almost directly north to the seaward kaikoura mountains , 145km away .
the city has been twinned with the dorset town of the same name for 30 years .
christchurch , new zealand weymouth beach weymouth beach as seen from outside the tourism information centre overlooking the esplanade towards the weymouth pavilion .
weymouth beach weymouth harbour webcam the image is of weymouth 's outer harbour , looking from the harbour master 's office across to the cove from the weymouth side of the river wey .
weymouth harbour webcam weymouth town bridge webcam the image is of weymouth 's outer harbour , looking from the harbour master 's office across to the cove from the weymouth side of the river wey .
weymouth town bridge webcam bookmark with : delicious digg reddit facebook stumbleupon what are these ?

skeleton , aged 5,500 , comes home the skeleton of a woman who lived 5,500 years ago goes on display in her home town , over a century after she was found .
work starts to save iconic church restoration work is about to begin on amlwch 's unique roman catholic church , shaped like an upturned boat .

bbc - north west wales - people & places - religion & ethics bbc - north west wales / religion & ethics bbc local -pipe- north west wales -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:37 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:37 uk work starts to save iconic church restoration work is about to begin on amlwch 's unique roman catholic church and parishioners hope they may be able to celebrate mass there by christmas .
dafydd 's new battle for volunteers he 's fought against bullies and battled serious illness .
now dafydd jones is highlighting the benefits of voluntary work .
more religion & ethics nuns ' rare outing for saint 's mass nuns from a closed order will make a rare trip outside the convent for an outdoor mass celebrating the life of st john roberts .
wildlife art and creation artist philip snow shares his skills and his creationist beliefs and helps the red squirrel at the same time .
criccieth buddhist shrine unveiled buddhist figures have been imported from tibet to be placed in the newly-extended shrine room at a retreat near criccieth .
humanists put secular view a humanist group for north wales is being formed after an inaugural meeting in bangor .
the aim is to represent secular views in society .
bangor to bethlehem bangor students have cultivated a close relationship with the people of bethlehem , running a farm and guesthouse .
a direct line to the spirit world elwyn edwards from bala acts as an interpreter for people who want to contact ' the other side ' and even reaches spirits down the phone .
past and present at cymer abbey the cistercian monks came to cymer abbey for peace and quiet .
and if they returned today , they would find not much has changed .

bbc - guernsey - people & places bbc - guernsey / people & places bbc local -pipe- guernsey -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:38 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:38 uk hms daring starts last sea trials hms daring , the royal navy warship affiliated to guernsey , has started her final sea trials before going on her first deployment .
the beginning of the occupation on 30 june 1940 german forces landed at guernsey airport signalling the start of what would be five years of occupation .
more people & places guernsey looks at art and islands experts choose guernsey as their venue to examine ' islomania ' - the attraction of islands to the artist and thinker .
seventy years on from occupation 30 june 1940 was the day german troops landed in guernsey and started a five year occupation of the island .
garden for community and bees a school in st peter port has started a gardening club to provide a community garden for children and wildlife .
honoured guernseymen three guernseymen receive royal recognition for their work in various aspects of guernsey from music to the law .
guernsey french promoter is 100 marie de garis has seen two world wars , the invention of tv and radio and has helped keep guernsey 's unique culture alive .
bubblegum bangers rally returns after a 3,000 mile journey around europe the bubblegum bangers , and their drivers , return to guernsey tired but enthusiastic .
exploring a history of the world ten items chosen from across guernsey tell stories from the island 's history and how it affected the world .
guernsey nurse heading to burma from darfur to burma nurse jo grimshaw is working with doctors of the world to help provide health care in remote areas .
rewriting guernsey 's dictionary nearly 30 years on from its last revision work is underway to update the dictionary of guernsey 's own language .
home to famous families now a residential home the house in the grounds of saumarez park has been home to some of guernsey 's most famous families .
classic mod with an indie twist the last of the light brigade mix the sounds of the who and the smiths to create their own take on indie rock .
two hundred years of protection fort george has stood above st peter port for 200 years and its imposing gates have greeted visitors to the fort since 1812 .

bbc - cornwall - things to do bbc - cornwall / things to do bbc local -pipe- cornwall -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:40 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:40 uk eden sessions 2010 doves and mumford & sons as well as calvin harris and audio bullys play eden this weekend .
find out all you need to know about the eden sessions .
the big weekend at trevaskis farm trevaskis farm near hayle are hosting their biggest ever event to date over the weekend .
st just lafrowda festival the most westerly town in england , st just , will soon begin its annual two-week celebration of lafrowda .
more things to do looe festival of the sea the looe festival of the sea is soon to get underway with the rnli organising the event .
sea , salt & sail in mousehole sea salt & sail is an intimate bi-annual festival held in the small village of mousehole in mid july .
newlyn fish festival 2010 august bank holiday monday will see the 20th anniversary of the newlyn fish festival .
set up your own big lunch street parties and picnics are being planned across the country to help people get to know their neighbours better .
rock oyster festival porthilly farm in rock will play host to the inaugural rock oyster festival over the weekend of 19th - 20th june this year .
the guide in cornwall it 's another busy weekend in cornwall including golowan , trewithen fun day , classic cars in newquay and the start of the eden sessions .
find out more in the guide the gul night surf at fistral the gul night surf at fistral beach , is once again on schedule for a fantastic weekend of surf , sun , music and entertainment .
falmouth 's sea shanty festival the popular falmouth international sea shanty festival is back in the town from friday 18 until sunday 20 june 2010 .
fundraising for the merlin project cornwall 's multiple sclerosis therapy centre , the merlin centre has been open for a year .
a big fundraising day is planned for late june .
relentless boardmasters europe 's largest extreme sports and music festival relentless boardmasters returns to newquay this august , see the full line-up .
celebrate life on the river fal the fal river festival runs from may 28th to june 6th 2010 , and is all about celebrating life on the river fal in cornwall .
du maurier festival 2010 the world renowned du maurier festival returns to fowey from mid may .
find out which celebrities will be heading to cornwall .
bbc local -pipe- cornwall -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe-

bbc - latin colour on swansea streets british broadcasting corporation home accessibility links skip to content skip to local navigation skip to bbc.co.uk navigation skip to bbc.co.uk search help accessibility help south west wales bbc radio wales listen live to bbc radio wales on iplayer listen again to bbc radio wales on iplayer bbc local south west wales things to do people & places nature & outdoors history religion & ethics arts & culture music tv & radio local bbc sites news sport weather travel neighbouring sites mid wales south east wales related bbc sites wales cymru de orllewin page last updated at 09:44 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:44 uk e-mail this to a friend printable version latin colour on swansea streets pupils produced posters for the event themselves using information and communication technology it 's generally warmer locations like brazil that are linked with carnivals , but now a swansea school is showing other europeans how we do it here .
hundreds of children playing samba drums are taking to the streets of the city .
and the music and colour they produce will be seen in estonia , italy , hungary , turkey and poland the brynhyfryd infant school summer carnival is putting the school and local community on the european map . ... planning this carnival has really brought out their skills in art and design , information technology and music .
head teacher kathryn richards european project film and photos of the carnival on are being streamed to partner schools in estonia , italy , hungary , turkey and poland on monday , 5 july .
it 's part of the school 's role as the lead partner in a major european arts project .
head teacher kathryn richards said : " we did have a smaller scale carnival a couple of years ago , but some months back i happened to be in brighton during the weekend of the brighton and hove carnival .
" with around 80 schools involved it was absolutely amazing . "
school staff have been trained to teach samba drumming so the children will be bringing the rhythms of rio to the streets of swansea .
and in a thrifty move , the pupils of the eco award-winning school have created drums by recycling old water coolers .
the youngsters will be grouped in blocks of vivid colour during the procession and have created huge flowers and a gigantic ladybird to carry with them .
carnival skills miss richards said , " the enthusiasm and creativity of both pupils and staff has been second to none , planning this carnival has really brought out their skills in art and design , information technology and music .
" as a school we pride ourselves on being at the heart of the community and the children have produced posters for the event themselves using ict -lrb- information and communication technology -rrb- and we 're expecting many of our neighbours to be lining the streets . "
the carnival starts at 2pm and heads down llangefelach road , which will be closed for the youngsters to process .
the parade will then progress down cross street , then eaton road , onto freeman street and back onto llangefelach road .

bbc - south west wales - latin colour on swansea streets / people & places bbc local -pipe- south west wales -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- 09:44 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:44 uk latin colour on swansea streets it 's generally warmer locations like brazil that are linked with carnivals , but now a swansea school is showing other europeans how we do it here .
hundreds of children playing samba drums are taking to the streets of the city .
and the music and colour they produce will be seen in estonia , italy , hungary , turkey and poland the brynhyfryd infant school summer carnival is putting the school and local community on the european map . " ... planning this carnival has really brought out their skills in art and design , information technology and music . "
head teacher kathryn richards european project film and photos of the carnival on are being streamed to partner schools in estonia , italy , hungary , turkey and poland on monday , 5 july .
it 's part of the school 's role as the lead partner in a major european arts project .
head teacher kathryn richards said : " we did have a smaller scale carnival a couple of years ago , but some months back i happened to be in brighton during the weekend of the brighton and hove carnival .
" with around 80 schools involved it was absolutely amazing . "
school staff have been trained to teach samba drumming so the children will be bringing the rhythms of rio to the streets of swansea .
and in a thrifty move , the pupils of the eco award-winning school have created drums by recycling old water coolers .
the youngsters will be grouped in blocks of vivid colour during the procession and have created huge flowers and a gigantic ladybird to carry with them .
carnival skills miss richards said , " the enthusiasm and creativity of both pupils and staff has been second to none , planning this carnival has really brought out their skills in art and design , information technology and music .
" as a school we pride ourselves on being at the heart of the community and the children have produced posters for the event themselves using ict -lrb- information and communication technology -rrb- and we 're expecting many of our neighbours to be lining the streets . "
the carnival starts at 2pm and heads down llangefelach road , which will be closed for the youngsters to process .
the parade will then progress down cross street , then eaton road , onto freeman street and back onto llangefelach road .

bbc - highlands - local news / tv & radio bbc local -pipe- highlands & isles -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- 09:46 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:46 uk local news bbc radio scotland broadcasts news bulletins in the inverness area .
they are broadcast each week day at these times : 06:54-07:00 07:50-08:00 09:58-10:00 11:59-12:00 12:54-13:00 15:58-16:00 16:54-17:00 17:58-18:00 the most recent bulletin is also available to listen again on demand on the radio scotland website .

bbc - leicester - people & places - nature & outdoors bbc - leicester / nature & outdoors bbc local -pipe- leicester -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:47 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:47 uk weather forecast for leicester a passionate amateur weatherman from leicestershire gives his weather forecast for city and county for the week .
more nature fruit almost ripe for the picking a leicestershire ' pick your own ' farm are hoping the harsh winter will not have damaged their strawberry crop this year .
new arrivals for rutland ospreys the osprey reintroduction project at rutland water goes from strength to strength as three chicks hatch on site .
ospreys nesting at rutland water a pair of ospreys are awaiting the arrival of three chicks after returning to rutland water to nest for 2010 .
bioblitz finds over 500 species watermead country park in leicestershire held a ' bioblitz ' as part of the bbc springwatch ' wild days out ' campaign .
take part : keep the bees buzzing be part of a bbc project that highlights the plight of the british bee and gives you the opportunity to do one thing for nature .
two years into the amazon jungle leicestershire 's ed stafford , now two years into his mission to walk the length of the amazon river , faces starvation and kidnap .
shooting fear for missing ospreys rutland water are appealing to the public for help to locate two missing ospreys , who they fear may have been illegally shot .
late spring suggests a hot summer wildlife officer mark graham successfully predicted a harsh winter using folklore techniques , but will we have a hot summer ?

bbc - dorset - people & places - nature & outdoors bbc - dorset / nature & outdoors bbc local -pipe- dorset -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:48 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:48 uk new access to purbeck heathland new areas of purbeck are being opened to walkers by the national trust , to give greater access to the heathland .
chesil beach centre could expand plans are in place to extend portland 's chesil beach centre as the team behind the proposals seek further funding for the project .
more nature whale watchers wanted the charity sea watch is seeking sea users to watch out for dolphins and whales along the dorset coastline this summer .
corfe castle wins award corfe castle has won an award for recent building work to repair and stabilise its stonework .
marking the bee part of it queen the queen bee at dorset 's bee part of it hive at hardy 's cottage in dorset has been marked for monitoring purposes .
behind the scenes of springwatch as springwatch 2010 draws to a close , bbc dorset takes a look behind the scenes as simon king and his team explore kimmeridge bay .
leatherback turtles head to coast according to the marine conservation society -lrb- mcs -rrb- , leatherback turtles could be heading to the dorset coast this year .
landscape photography awards the forth landscape photographer of the year awards - the brainchild of gillingham photographer charlie waite - are open for submissions .
hardy 's bees move into their hive bees have taken up residence in dorset 's bee part of it hive at hardy 's cottage in higher bockhampton .
butterflies thrive on quarry site long celebrated for its limestone , portland also has a reputation for an array of butterflies , which enjoy the shelter of the now disused quarry .
cattle to help rare butterflies for the first time in decades , cattle have been put out to graze on a common near sturminster newton to help protect a rare butterfly species .
dorset has ' third of bat species ' there are 17 species of bat in the uk and up to five of these can be seen at radipole lake in weymouth .
coast is ' key ' for bird ringing bird ringing , a method of tracking birds , is an important tool in learning about dorset 's ever changing bird population .
shellfish conservation for dorset the underwater life of the dorset coast is being threatened by divers taking too many shellfish , according to conservationists .
dorset bee hive ready for action the bee part of it bee hive has arrived at hardy 's cottage in higher bockhampton and is assembled with the help of local beekeeping expert chris slade .
boy encourages veg growing a boy from bridport is taking part in a national trust campaign to encourage children to grow their own fruit and vegetables .

bbc - kent - things to do bbc - kent / things to do bbc local -pipe- kent -pipe- things to do -pipe- people & places -pipe- tv & radio -pipe- page last updated at 09:52 gmt , monday , 5 july 2010 10:52 uk the secrets of sevenoaks ' knole robert sackville-west tells stories of knole , a beautiful english mansion , his family 's home for hundreds of years .
are you ready for the big lunch ?
we are inviting you to have lunch with your neighbours – in streets , parks , gardens , car parks on sunday 18 july .
submit your events to the guide if you are holding an event which you think we could feature in our weekly events guide , please tell us all about it .
more things to do charles darwin 's kent sanctuary down house in kent provided charles darwin with a home where he could both study and spend time with his family .
tours for the visually impaired a collection of audio tours around some of kent 's town , made by the visually impaired for the visually impaired .
the tunbridge wells music scene the tunbridge wells forum is somewhat of a legendary venue for up and coming bands history of the world : kent 's past a boat , a mask and a leather football are just three of the objects chosen to tell the story of kent 's past .
shooting wildlife through a lens you can create stunning photographs with even the simplest camera .
follow our tips and create a masterpiece .
tour of folkestone 's music scene folkestone is generating some really exciting young bands and has a handful of good venues including the new quarter house .
music scene in the medway towns with more students piling in to the medway towns , the scene is thriving .
